Text: RE MID C Questionpst Thanks Original Message From Gang Lisa Sent Tuesday June AM To Luong Steven Subject RE MID C Question is a fixed rate per MW It is a semi daily and monthly purchase In other words we buy it daily however they understand we need it on a monthly basis The price is the same for daily or monthly It seems rare we get cut on this transmission Ive been here for about months now and we have yet to be cut on this transmission This coming summer may be a different story Air Products is a MondayThursday deal We are currently purchasing at Midc to fill the position for Tuesday and Wednesday Hope this helps Lisa Original Message From Luong Steven Sent Monday June PM To Gang Lisa Cc Sewell Doug Subject RE MID C Question Thanks Lisa Is the a fixed rate for every month or does it vary Also do we buy that daily monthly or longer term than that Are there ever any problems with availability of the transmission history of curtailments Finally what do we do with the extra power on the days Air Products doesnt take it I think I remember the deal being for every day but Tuesdays and Wed or something strange like that I know that is a lot of questions Thanks for your help Steve Original Message From Sewell Doug Sent Monday June PM To Luong Steven Subject FW MID C Question here you go Original Message From Gang Lisa Sent Monday June PM To Sewell Doug Subject FW MID C Question I purchase Snohomish Transmission to deliver power from MID C to Montana sys The Transmission cost is per mw This cost is added in addition to the power price at MID C The Air Products deal is at MID C We fill this position by purchasing at MID C I hope this helps Lisa Original Message From Luong Steven Sent Monday June PM To Gang Lisa Cc Irani Eric Subject MID C Question Hi Lisa I am working on a Hedging Activity Report that will be sent to EY on a weekly basis I think Mo is out of the office so I heard that you might be the right person to ask for help For the first week I am using a spreadsheet that Mo sent where he bought some July power at MID C It looks like the MID C power along with our NW Del length makes us flat for July at MID C and Montana System Border as well My questions are How does power flow between MID C and the other delivery points like Montana Do we incur a transmission cost on top of what he bought the power for We are actually a little long MWh bc of the Air Products deal that is a little unique what happens to this length If its easier to explain over the phone please give me a call at Thanks for your help Steve

RE Purchases for Jan PST Holden Please email me the February and March worksheet when it is available Thanks Steve Original Message From Salisbury Holden Sent Thursday January PM To Thome Stephen Baughman Edward Luong Steven Subject Purchases for Jan Here are the purchases we are making for the balance of January File DealsJanxls

FW Customer Names Cc PST FYI Original Message From Wax Brandon Sent Friday January PM To Luong Steven Subject FW Customer Names Original Message From Thome Stephen Sent Friday January PM To Wax Brandon Subject Customer Names Brandon The names you may be looking for are WAPA Lower Colorado WALC WAPA Municipal Power WAMP NP Sierra Pacific Power Company Colorado River Commission Grays Harbor The WAPA acronyms just represent the particular office we are dealing with

RE Customer List Cc PST I believe it is Louisiana Pacific Steve Original Message From White Stacey W Sent Friday January PM To Luong Steven Cc Postlethwaite John Subject RE Customer List What is the exact name for Georgia Pacific We do not see any transactions with them in the system Stacey Original Message From Luong Steven Sent Thursday January PM To White Stacey W Subject Customer List File customers served xls Don asked me to send you this file

RE Northwest book of business for FebruaryMessage From Crandall Sean Sent Tuesday January PM To Luong Steven Subject RE Northwest book of business for February Heres what changes COB We are not going to deliver to Midesto Deal MC BPA deal and Busbar BPA deal are cancelled Original Message From Luong Steven Sent Tuesday January AM To Crandall Sean Subject RE Northwest book of business for February Sean Do the Feb and March positions you sent this morning account for the termination of the two BPA contracts If not can you send me a revised version when you get a chance I am not sure which BPA deals here are terminated and which ones are still good Thanks Steve Original Message From Crandall Sean Sent Tuesday January AM To Luong Steven Thome Stephen Subject Northwest book of business for February Point BuySale Counterparty On Off Price Deal Annuity COB NS B BPA COB NS B BPA COB NS B BPA COB NS B BPA COB NS B CRC COB NS S MIDESTO COB NS S SPP COB NS Total BUSBAR B BPA BUSBAR S BPA BUSBAR S MCMINN BUSBAR Total MC B BPA x MC B BPA x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S Air Products x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S BPA x MC S CRC x MC S DOUGLAS x MC S GRAYS x MC S INTEL x MC Total Montana S ASH GROVE Might be out Montana S LOUISIANA PAC Montana S LOUISIANA PAC Montana S LUZENACA Montana Total NW DEL B CLATSKAN NW DEL Total Grand Total Total MC Total NW
